text: Naropa University is a private liberal arts college in Colorado. It was started in 1974 by Ch√∂gyam Trungpa. It is named after Naropa, a Buddhist Mahasiddha who lived in the eleventh century. It has three campuses: Araphoe, Paramita, and Nalanda. ==References== Category:Colleges and universities in Colorado Category:1974 establishments in the United States Category:1970s establishments in Colorado
title: Naropa University
